column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=PART TEN
#Text=We are sitting at a table and we are writing this upon paper made thousands of years ago .
#Text=The light is dim , and we cannot see the Golden One , only one lock of gold on the pillow of an ancient bed .
#Text=This is our home .
#Text=We came upon it today , at sunrise .
#Text=For many days we had been crossing a chain of mountains .

#Text=The forest rose among cliffs , and whenever we walked out upon a barren stretch of rock we saw great peaks before us in the west , and to the north of us , and to the south , as far as our eyes could see .
#Text=The peaks were red and brown , with the green streaks of forests as veins upon them , with blue mists as veils over their heads .
#Text=We had never heard of these mountains , nor seen them marked on any map .
#Text=The Uncharted Forest has protected them from the Cities and from the men of the Cities .
#Text=We climbed paths where the wild goat dared not follow .
#Text=Stones rolled from under our feet , and we heard them striking the rocks below , farther and farther down , and the mountains rang with each stroke , and long after the strokes had died .
#Text=But we went on , for we knew that no men would ever follow our track nor reach us here .
#Text=Then today , at sunrise , we saw a white flame among the trees , high on a sheer peak before us .
#Text=We thought that it was a fire and stopped .
#Text=But the flame was unmoving , yet blinding as liquid metal .
#Text=So we climbed toward it through the rocks .
#Text=And there , before us , on a broad summit , with the mountains rising behind it , stood a house such as we had never seen , and the white fire came from the sun on the glass of its windows .
#Text=The house had two stories and a strange roof flat as a floor .
#Text=There was more window than wall upon its walls , and the windows went on straight around the corners , though how this kept the house standing we could not guess .
#Text=The walls were hard and smooth , of that stone unlike stone which we had seen in our tunnel .
#Text=We both knew it without words : this house was left from the Unmentionable Times .
#Text=The trees had protected it from time and weather , and from men who have less pity than time and weather .
#Text=We turned to the Golden One and we asked :
#Text=" Are you afraid ? "
#Text=But they shook their head .
#Text=So we walked to the door , and we threw it open , and we stepped together into the house of the Unmentionable Times .
#Text=We shall need the days and the years ahead , to look , to learn , and to understand the things of this house .
#Text=Today , we could only look and try to believe the sight of our eyes .
#Text=We pulled the heavy curtains from the windows and we saw that the rooms were small , and we thought that not more than twelve men could have lived here .
#Text=We thought it strange that men had been permitted to build a house for only twelve .
#Text=Never had we seen rooms so full of light .
#Text=The sunrays danced upon colors , colors , more colors than we thought possible , we who had seen no houses save the white ones , the brown ones and the grey .
#Text=There were great pieces of glass on the walls , but it was not glass , for when we looked upon it we saw our own bodies and all the things behind us , as on the face of a lake .
#Text=There were strange things which we had never seen and the use of which we do not know .
#Text=And there were globes of glass everywhere , in each room , the globes with the metal cobwebs inside , such as we had seen in our tunnel .
#Text=We found the sleeping hall and we stood in awe upon its threshold .
#Text=For it was a small room and there were only two beds in it .
#Text=We found no other beds in the house , and then we knew that only two had lived here , and this passes understanding .
#Text=What kind of world did they have , the men of the Unmentionable Times ?
#Text=We found garments , and the Golden One gasped at the sight of them .
#Text=For they were not white tunics , nor white togas ; they were of all colors , no two of them alike .
#Text=Some crumbled to dust as we touched them .
#Text=But others were of heavier cloth , and they felt soft and new in our fingers .
#Text=We found a room with walls made of shelves , which held rows of manuscripts , from the floor to the ceiling .
#Text=Never had we seen such a number of them , nor of such strange shape .
#Text=They were not soft and rolled , they had hard shells of cloth and leather ; and the letters on their pages were so small and so even that we wondered at the men who had such handwriting .
#Text=We glanced through the pages , and we saw that they were written in our language , but we found many words which we could not understand .
#Text=Tomorrow , we shall begin to read these scripts .
#Text=When we had seen all the rooms of the house , we looked at the Golden One and we both knew the thought in our minds .
